title: Quantitative Analysis in Social Research Methodology: Practical Application Process Based on Blended Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Statistical Concepts and Foundational Knowledge of Social Science Research Methodologies, with Data Application Experience in Workplace Settings
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented training for field professionals. Requires optimization of offline activities within limited tech environments (primarily smartphones).

learning_goals: Learners can explain the stages of quantitative research design for analyzing social phenomena: variable selection → hypothesis formulation → measurement tool development.
Learners can analyze collected data using smartphone-based statistical tools (e.g., Google Forms, mobile SPSS).
Learners can create actionable insight reports (3-5 pages) that apply research findings to practical work contexts.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
